title: Mum-to-be blasted for putting positive pregnancy test stick on cake to announce joy
text:

A mother-to-be was branded "gross" for putting a used pregnancy test on top of a cake announcing her baby news.

The woman disgusted guests after resting the device on top of the blue and white icing.

A photo, which has emerged on social media, shows the icing below the used stick read "we're pregnant", but people were revolted by the thought that the stick had been urinated on.

They blasted the woman for her "lack of hygiene".

"You literally p****d on that stick, but sure, go ahead and stick it on top of the cake," one person wrote.

Another commented: "That's f*****g gross. Hands down no amount of bleach that could ever make that okay."

A third added: "Dude, I don't care if you put the lid back on it... don't stick something you peed on on a cake! That should not have to be said!"

The photo has garnered more than 1,000 "likes" and more than 400 comments on a cake-shaming Facebook page.

"I don't even like bringing food into a bathroom let alone putting a whizz stick on the food...even if they bleached it that is still uncomfortable and not appetising in any way," wrote another member of the group.

But others suggested what appeared to be a pregnancy test could in fact be a very "realistic" cake topper.

(Image: Facebook/Well, That's Certainly A Cake Wreck)

One person wrote: "Maybe the pregnancy stick is just very realistic fondant? Somehow I doubt that though."

Another pointed out: "A malformed fondant pregnancy test would be better."

Others took issue another aspect of the cake entirely, arguing that "we're pregnant" is dated.

One person complained: "I hate that 'we' sh*t. She's pregnant, 'we' are going to have a baby."

Another noted: "I get irrationally bothered by people saying 'we're' pregnant when referring to a couple in which one person is carrying the child."
description: The pregnancy test stick, which showed the couple are expecting, would have previously been urinated on
